inn1.comm: Some movement all right. It seamed away from the stumps and veered down the leg side. Wide of course but it should be interesting if he can start it around the off stump line
again swinging towards the pads, McCullum goes flying to make a half-stop
pushes this across the batsman, around the off, defended to the off side. He is sure to go for that inswinger (to the lefty) again. Can he get the line right?
tries the inswinger but again on the pads, rolls away to square-leg region. Well, now a right-handed batsman on strike. here we go
from wide of the crease and from that angle he couldn't get it to swing and Dilshan whacks the full-length delivery but straight to cover
closer to the stumps as he releases the ball, lands around the middle, on a length, and curves away to off and middle, pushed out to the off
outswinger in the zone and Dilshan has a big swing and a miss. Oohs and aahs from the men behind the stumps
probing delivery around the off stump line, stabbed of the inner edge past the stumps
lovely delivery! jaffa! It bounced extra from short of length and surprised Dilshan who had a defensive poke at it. The ball flashed past the edge.
fuller in length outside off, Dilshan leans for the square drive but the bottom-hand comes off the handle and the ball rolls through cover point
on the middle stump line, full on a length, defended to the off
cuts in with bounce, moves past the prod, strikes the thigh and rolls away to square-leg. dilshan wants a run before he gets back in time to beat the direct hit from Kane
on a length, around off, dilshan drives to mid-off.
full in length around off stump, driven to mid-off
full in length, on the middle, turned out to the leg side. So far two ball straight with the angle. Will he try to curve in the next ball?
short in length and just outside off, cut down to third man for a single.
Screaming bouncer but too high and it leaps over Baz who jumps but can't haul it back in
full and straight, driven hard but straight to mid-off. A feet or two to left or right of that fielder might have got him four
in the corridor from a good length, Dilshan tries to whack it through the off but makes no contact

Tharanga is run out. It was driven right down the track, Tharanga backed up too far, and Southee got a hand on the ball as he dived to stop it and the ball rolled on to hit the stumps. Accidental run out but NZ will take it. Tharanga back to hut
angles right across Sanga, who is beaten, poking at it
stays back to push this to third man for a single
in the zone outside off, run down to third man
slanted across Sanga who watches it sail through to the keeper

run out appeal against Sanga. It was nudged to backward square-leg, Sanga had set off for the run but  Guptill was placed there. Sanga hurried back and there was a direct hit but Sanga  dived to get back in time. The ball ricochets off the stumps  to the boundary
leans forward to defend to the on side
leans forward to drive to mid-off.  Again straight to the fielder.
full in length on the middle, punched back to Southee who threatens to throw but holds on to the ball. Danny Morrison is loving it on the air.

Caught at third man! he was not slashing or upper cutting but actually trying to whip it to the on side. he chose the wrong length for it. It landed short in length on the middle and leg and straightened. Dilshan got a leading edge and the ball swirled away to Oram at third man
shot. He leans forward to whip a full delivery through midwicket region
in the zone outside off stump, left alone
leans forward and across to steer the length delivery to point
lands on a length around off and straightens, Mahela pushes it to the off
What a mess-up from Bennett at mid-on. It was on driven to his right and he seemed to had it covered when he slid across but the ball went right through him!
turns this to square-leg region
in the zone outside off stump, left alone
lands full in length outside off and straightens. Mahela shoulders arms
further away from the off stump and Mahela lets this one go past him as well
gets behind the line to defend this one carefully
fuller and outside off, Sanga reaches out, jams his bat on the ground even as the ball rushes past the edge. Sanga then goes for a walk towards square-leg
good probing delivery in the zone and Sanga is caught in two minds- to play or to leave and lets it go in the end.
gets this one to come back in to Sanga but it drifts to the middle and leg line and Sanga wrists it to fine-leg region where Oram makes a fine diving save
in the zone outside off, pushed out to cover
in the corridor outside off, left alone
around 138 kmph and drifting to the pads. What's that cliche? ah yeah .. "Easy pickings" Mahela wrists it away, very stylishly if I might add.
gets it correct this time; on a good length and around that off stump, defended to cover
goes for the yorker, just outside off and Mahela digs it back to the bowler
gets forward to work this past square-leg ... Southee runs in to stop but lets the ball slip through his fingers. Hot and humid day, beginning to take its toll already.
good line and length around that off and Mahela pushes it quietly to the off
confusion between the two batsman after Mahela turns it to left of midwicket  and they decide to retreat
in the zone outside off, left alone
gets forward to drive wide of mid-off for a single. Sanga gets across to the other end, turns back and nods at Mahela
gets forward to push this to mid-on
fine delivery, It landed on a good length on the off-stump line and cut away. Mahela adjusts his hands and steers the ball to third man
Another good delivery; cramps Sanga for room on the middle and off line and cutting away from him: Sanga stabs it of the outer edge and third man can't get across in time
full in length outside off stump, left alone
full in length outside off stump, pushed out to mid-off
low full toss but Mahela punches it straight to cover!
full, very full, on the middle and off line, Mahela jams it out to the off
another full delivery, just short of the blockhole, dug out to point .
goes for yet another yorker, again just short of the blockhole, turned behind square-leg
oh boy he is going after those yorkers here. this one ends up a dipping low full toss, and Sanga gets an inside edge as he tries to dig it out
angles away from the off stump, left alone
on the off stump line, turned to backward point
And again. Mccullum is standing up to the stumps
on the off stump line, defended to the off
on the middle stump line, worked towards midwicket for a single
gets forward to push this to mid-on
on the middle and leg, turned to short fine-leg fielder
slants this across Sanga, not a yorker but on a good length, left alone
around the off stump line, defended back to the bowler
full in length around off, Sanga pushes it to the leg side. Good tight over so far.
in the corridor outside off and Sanga lets Baz take it
classy! Sanga leans forward to cream a length delivery on the off stump line to the left of mid-off.
drives this to covers, crisp timing, but straight to the short extra cover fielder
cuts in with some extra bounce, tucked thro backward square-leg and Brendon rushes after it but they will get two
again seams in, moves past the prod and rolls away of the thigh pad
lands on the leg stump line, moves towards middle and off, pushed back to the bowler
on the middle stump line, pushed back to the bowler
banged in a bouncer on the middle and Sanga goes down under
in the zone outside off, angling away, left alone
leans forward to drive straight to cover
slower, just outside off, nudged to short third man region
pushes this wide outside off stump,. No ball, though. Free hit coming up. Break-free time.
full delivery and Sanga slices it up and over mid-off.
full delivery around off, caressed to left of short cover who dives to make a half-stop
in the channel outside off, tries to late cut and is beaten
full and just outside off, defended on the front foot
lean  forward to defend to the off side
wobbles away in the air and cuts away through the corridor, left alone
gets forward to nudge this behind square-leg for a single
full in length and on the middle and off line, eased back to the bowler
further away from the off stump, left alone
good delivery, cutting back in to move past the defensive poke and hitting the thigh pad.
Crash! Full pitched and width outside off, Sanga leans across to cream it through covers. Poor delivery first-up
fuller, closer to the off, driven to mid-off
gets forward to defend a good-length delivery back to the bowler
full in length around off, pushed out to cover
leans across to drive to cover
on the middle stump line, tapped back to Franklin
gets behind the line to stab this one to the leg side
leans forward to drive to short extra cover
full in length and on the stumps and Mahela stretches forward to nudge it to the leg side
this one straightens on the off stump line and Mahela adjusts to defend it to the off
gets back and across to defend this carefully.
straightens outside off, extra bounce too, Mahela adjusts, gets his hands up and jabs the ball to point
leans forward to nudge it to the leg side
leans forward to drive to mid-off
gets forward to drive to right of mid-off for a single
short in length, bounces outside off, run down to third man
drifts to the pads, flicked away behind square-leg
stays back to defend to the leg side
floated full on the off, eased down to long-on. 50 partnership up.
nudges this to short mid-on region. Styris will bowl a lot of off cutters
fullish around off, squirted out to backward point
wafts this past square-leg for a single
taps this to point for a single
leans forward to drive to long-off for a single
around the off stump line, punched out to cover
quickish, just outside off, punched out to sweeper cover
stays round the stumps for Mahela as well, floats it around off, driven back to him
turns this to deep square-leg region for a single
on the pads, rolls away to short fine-leg
floated full around off, driven to long-off
around the off stump line, dabbed to midwicket
on the leg stump line, nurdled around the corner for a single
fullish , just outside off, driven back to Styris
slightly slower, drifts away from the off stump line and Sanga checks his shot and it stops on him and the ball is in the air but wide of the bowler
fuller and straighter, driven to long-on
full delivery around off stump line, eased to long-off
leans forward to defend to cover
gets forward to dab this to the off.
around the off stump line, squirted to square-leg
from round the stumps, on the middle, turned to midwicket
works it to right of midwicket where Guptill makes a fine dive and they will get a single
gets forward to work this through the on side for a single
flicks it from the off stump line where Ryder makes a mess and they get an extra run.
stays back to drive to cover
again punches but can't beat Taylor at covers
floats this fuller and slower and wider outside off, slashed away to sweeper cover
full and straight on the middle, on driven for a single
The reverse sweep! He picked it from outside leg and swept it over backward point. A bit of top edge as well

Great catch or may be not What a stunner! Nathan mcCullum has gone flying! It stopped a touch on Mahela who ended up chipping his defensive shot well to the right of the bowler. Nathan took couple of steps to his right and flew. The ball was dying on him when he got his palms under it. Mahela is not convinced it was taken cleanly. The third ump has been called.  He caught in between his forefinger and middle-finger i reckon. What an amazing effort. He ended up at short mid-on region! Third ump says it might have touched the ground. Oh dear. I am not sure it did. Nathan is upset, he has a talk with the umpire. Ross Taylor gets in as well. It's a cruel batsman's game; the benefit of doubt always goes to him.
leans forward to on drive to long-on
worked through the on side for a single
leans forward to nudge this to the on side
on the middle and leg, Mahela plays a sweep shot to pick up a boundary
short in length outside off, punched away to long-off
on the middle and off, turned behind square-leg
leans forward to nudge it back to the bowler
leans forward to drive to short extra cover
stays back to punch it to long-on
lovely shot, just outside off and Mahela opens the bat-face to glide it late to third man boundary
short in length just outside off, cut to left of backward point where Taylor makes a fine stop
flighted on a length on the middle and leg, lifted aerially but short of long-on
flatter, on the off, turned to midwicket
slightly slower, shorter in length, cut to short third man
leans forward to ping long-on. 9000 ODI runs for Sanga. The fourth Sri Lankan to achieve it. Whaddaplayaa!
short in length, pulled away for a single
leans forward to drive to the on side and Styris intercepts
Lovely paddle shot. The ball runs to the fine-leg boundary where Hamish Bennett makes a fine diving save.
short in length outside off, dabbed to short third man region
width outside off, slahed away to sweeper cover. Fifty up for Sanga. 62nd ODI fifty. Mahela gets across to congratulate him
almost yorker length on the middle and leg, dug out to the leg side
low full toss, punched down to long-on
leans forward to defend this to the leg side
goes down the track to drive to long-off
gets forward to scoop this over the bowler's head ...  Franklin makes a neat sliding stop at the long-off boundary
gets forward to push-drive this back down the track
gets forward to drive and almost yorks himself; ends up stabbing it to the off
And again. This time he digs it out back to the bowler
good delivery, cutting back in with bounce, stabbed to point. But it's a no ball. Free hit coming up. > Shouldn't have been given a no ball for he landed behind the line before he slid forward.
the slower bouncer, pulled away past square-leg
short in length, skids across Sanga who goes for the pull but doesn't connect
bangs in a high bouncer. Wide.
lands on a good length and straightens. That straightening surprised Sanga who jabs it to the off side
yorker length outside off, jabbed away to backward point
full delivery, worked to midwicket
full delivery, mistimed to short extra cover and Sanga has a look at the bottom of his bat
from round the stumps, on the pads, worked through midwicket
gets forward to on drive to long-on for a single
fetches it from outside off and sweeps it for a single
works this through the on side for a single
gets forward to drive to cover
Whack! He went down on his knee and slog swept this hard. Really hard.
low full toss, around waist high, Mahela shovels it over backward square-leg region
full in length around off, driven to cover
fullish delivery outside off, dug out to backward point
leans forward to work it for a single through the on side
really full delivery, eased down to long-on
gets forward to drag this to long-on
gets forward to ping Frankln at long-off
on the middle and leg, turned past square-leg ... Fifty for Mahela 56th ODI fifty.
moves down the track to work this to backward square-leg region
leans forward to push it to the off side
backs away to chip it in the air but short of long-off
just outside off, dabbed to backward point
Run out appeal against Mahela It was nudged to the off and he charged across There was a direct hit at the non-striker's end but Mahela was home

Stumping appeal. Mahela went for the big hit, dragged his back foot outside the line. He drags his back foot back towards the crease  and does he get it back in time? He seems to have done so. Third ump reckons he gets it back in time.
backs away to cut hard to left of point where Jamie How makes a fine diving stop
really full delivery, mistimes his drives to the off
a lovely dipping slower one, Mahela just about manages to pick it, checks his shot and defends
Fabulicious shot! It was a full-length delivery just outside off and Mahela crouches, opens his bat-face and plays a delectable late steer through vacant slips.
moves forward for the big hit and drags it to deep midwicket
from round the stumps now, tucked behind square-leg
full delivery outside off, blasted hard but straight to short cover
length delivery well outside off, Sanga goes for the cut, under edges it to the ground and it bounces to the keeper
full pitched outside off, mistimes it to long-on
backs away, franklin delivers from round the stumps and at the body of Mahela who jabs it to the off
on the middle stump line, sluggish track, punched down to long-on
short in length around off, Mahela laps it around the corner, behind square-leg
Top shot! Treat to watch. It was a full delivery on the middle stump line, Sanga cleared his front leg, held his balance and lifted it to the straight boundary
slower off cutter, driven past Mahela for a single
That late cut again! Awww. he backed away, waited for the cutter to move towards the off stump before he opened the bat-face and steered it to third man boundary
works this past midwicket for a single
moves outside the leg stump and forces it to deep cover
quicker one outside off, Sanga stabs it in the air but short of backward point
taps this to square-leg for a single
full delivery from round the stumps, on driven to long-on
quickish delivery outside off, full in length but Sanga stays back to unfurl a peach of a cut shot. He waited on it and cut it really square.
on the off stump line, pushed out to cover
wide down the leg side.
Oh dear! he just sprayed it way down the leg side

Mahela goes for DRS after being given lbw. It lands full in length on the middle stump line and slid towards the leg stump. Mahela played all around it, trying to flick it away. It would have crashed into the leg stump
just outside the off stump, and Angelo, promoted up the order, defends
around the off stump line, tapped to point for a single
bouncer around the off stump line, Sanga sways away
Another bouncer and this time Sanga ducks
full delivery outside off, driven to cover
on the off stump line, nudged to short mid-on region
slower, shortish, Angelo ends up lapping it across the line to short midwicket
high bouncer. Wide. It did sail high over the batsman.
full in length on the middle, glanced down to fine-leg region
low full toss on the pads, turned down to fine-leg fielder.
fullish, dipping on the pads, flicked away for a single
slower one, on the middle and leg, turned to midwicket for a single
goes for the yorker, dug out to cover for a single
down the track and hits it down the track; the bowler gets his left hand out to make a half-stop
poor delivery- full and well outside off and Sanga slashes it up and over point. He was down on his knee when he finished that shot.
Crunched! It was banged in short and just outside off, Sanga arched back, created room and cut it up and over backward point boundary. Fab strike

Oh whadddaplayaaa! Talk about creating room. It was the bouncer from round the stumps, aiming for his body. Sanga back-pedals towards leg, gets away from the line of fire and upper cut it over backward point. Great improvisation.
back over the stumps now; fullish on the pads, flicked away to deep square-leg region
gift - full delivery down the leg side and Sanga does what he had to do - get bat on ball.

That's his hundred. He turns a slower one to fine-leg and raises his arms aloft as he crosses over. The crowd applaud and so do his team-mates from the dressing room. Sanga last hit a ton in June 2008. 63 innings without a hundred.
full delivery, driven through mid-on for a single
slower cutter outside off, dabbed to backward point for a single
low dipping full toss, on driven to long-on
More innovation. It was a full delivery on the stumps, Sanga moves outside leg , and square drives it to the boundary
Sanga whacks a full delivery to the straight boundary where Jamie How makes a fine diving save, rushing to his right from long-on
full delivery on the off, tapped to the off
a yorker from round the stumps, Sanga was moving towards leg, crouches to dig it out to the off
takes a couple of steps down the track and thumps it past Sanga
another yorker- they keep coming - pushed out to point region .. overthrows ..
goes down the track and drives on the up to extra cover
yorker length outside off and Sanga tries to dig it out ... no wood on leather
works this past square-leg for a single
on the middle stump line, from round the stumps, punched to long-off
on the middle and off, from round the stumps, worked past square-leg

Nathan can finally smile. He has picked a wicket. Full and straight, Sanga goes for the big slog sweep but makes no contact. Clatter!  Sanga has ended the ton-drought and Sri Lanka would be so glad that the skipper is in great form just ahead of the knockouts
leans forward to nudge it to midwicket
on the middle, eased back to the bowler
in the zone outside off, steered through point
short in length around off stump line, dabbed to short fine-leg
full in length on the middle, dabbed to midwicket
on the pads, turned around the corner for a single. Guptill fires a direct hit at the non-striker's end from short fine-leg position
full in length and outside off, Thilan tries to square drive of the front foot but no luck
on the middle stump line, squeezed through point
moves down the track, gets outside the leg stump and lifts it inside out over extra cover
plays the square drive to pick up a single
quickish delivery, Angelo was setting himself for the big hit and defends in the end f
flicks it past square-leg to pick up couple of runs
goes down the track but mishits it to midwicket
quickish delivery on the off, nudged to midwicket
Samaraweera tries to back away and cut but gets a thick edge and Baz does well to take the catch. He was standing up to the stumps, moved his hands quickly to right to pouch that
gets forward to push this to cover for a single
full and drifting on to the pads, Angelo fails to take the opportunity. the ball rolls away of the pad
yorker length on the middle and leg, dug out to the leg side
drives this to long-on for a single
stays back to punch this to long-on for a single
from round the stumps, on the middle, nudged to midwicket
low dipping full delivery,, hit back to the bowler
Nathan nearly spills this one but gets it on the rebound. Silva scooped a tame return catch but Nathan doesn't take it cleanly but lunges to catch it on the rebound. And he sports a big smile!
goes on with the arm from the leg and middle line, leading edge to the off
dabs this to square-leg for a single
on the pads, rolls away to the leg side
this one goes flying down the leg side. Wide
on the middle and leg, again Kula doesn't connect with his dab.. leg bye
Fab shot! It was a full-length delivery on the middle and leg.... Angelo just leans across, and paddles it up and over short fine-leg fielder!
backs away to drive the low full toss to long-on
short in length on the middle stump line, pushed out to the off

Shortish delivery, Kula pulls, Guptill nearly lost it at deep midwicket. he almost over ran to his right even as the ball seemed to have swerved to his left. Somehow, he managed to stop, tilt back and held on to the catch!
slower one outside off, nudged to square-leg for a single
full delivery going down the leg and it rolls away of the pad
a bouncer on the off stump line, Malinga tries to steer it up and over gully but makes no contact. he has a look at Angelo and smiles
Lasithaaaaaaa!  he has absolutely thumped this. It was a length delivery around off, he cleared the front foot and smacked it over long-on
Brendon has taken a smart catch. It was a top-edged pull and Brendon rushed back and to his left. He hared down and lunged out to take a good catch
Brendon almost pouches a beauty. It was the short ball on the leg stump line, edges the pull and Brendon flies to his left but can't reach it
full and straight, driven to long-on
back away to drive a dipping full toss - attempted yorker- to long-on for couple of runs
goes for another yorker, low dipping full delivery on the middle, dragged off the inside edge past square-leg
The yorkers keep coming. Great effort on such a humid day. Its been stabbed to midwicket
What a delicious six! another yorker attempted but this one lands short of the block hole. Mural cleared his front foot and scooped it up and over the straight boundary!
the bouncer comes, Murali tries to pull but the ball flies through to the keeper
slower one, fullish, lands on a length on the leg stump line, Angelo opens his stance, clears the front foot and swipes it between deep midwicket and long-on

Murali is run out Angelo drills this to left of  long-on where Guptill makes a fine save and fires a superbly accurate throw to Oram, who collects and breaks the stumps. Murali is short of the crease.
moves outside the leg stump, crouches to pick a delivery short of the blockhole and drags it to midwicket boundary. Kane throws in a desperate dive but can't stop it
moves outside leg again and hits this to long-on for a single
Angelo had warned Mendis that it might be a bouncer, or so it seemed,  and bouncer it is. mendis can't connect with the upper cut
another bouncer, Mendis attempts a pull shot this time but no wood on leather again

inn2.comm: starts off with a wide down the leg side, but the ball seemed to make some noise as it passed Guptill. Sanga did not collect it cleanly anyway.
whoa, late start from the runners as Guptill defends from outside off backward of point and Dilshan swoops in and fumbles. Single taken in the end.
Baz is away, tucking a 144 kph length ball hurled at the hips away to backward square leg
Guptill hangs back on off stump and steers from outside off to third man for a single
144 kph, no movement so far for Malinga, lands it on a length and Baz reaches half forward to defend to the off side
on middle stump once again, no room or length to work with, Baz defends to mid on
ahem, extra bounce there or did it just stop on Baz? 137.4 kph on off stump, it jumps up as he moves into a check drive and hits the splice.
ohho, a Kula special to start off, lands half a foot outside off and ends half a foot outside leg! It darts in like a yoyo off the seam and Guptill has no clue as he swipes from the crease
again huge inward curl for Kula, but this goes down the leg side
back of a length on off stump, Guptill just covers the line and defends to the off side
now one that holds its line, planting seeds of doubt in Guptill's mind as he goes for a late attempt at the cut shot and misses
genuine away seam movement this time, comes in with the angle, lands outside off and shapes away. Guptill leaves and Sanga collects
this is exceptional sleight of hand from Kula. Another inducker, Guptill did not pick it as he shouldered arms. It buzzes past the outside edge
top-notch over. Ends with a regulation back of length ball angling in towards off stump line, and Guptill is more than ready to let it go
fullish length on middle and leg, Baz works it from the crease to mid on for a single
pacy delivery outside off, 143 kph and on a length, Guptill's left more than he's played so far.
Guptill steals a single, mistiming a defensive back foot push to mid on as Malinga thuds it in short at 145 kph. They scurry across by the time Murali comes in from mid on
short of driving again on off stump, Baz tries to force it away through the off side, but finds cover
Baz has cracked him away for four. Short of a length, no movement but not much width. Baz creates his own, stands tall and cuts on top of the bounce in front of point for four
Malinga goes fuller this time, on the pads, Baz quietly taps to midwicket for a single

another one of those monster cuts from Baz, he really does play this shot with some authority. Back of a length outside off, no movement this time for Kula, Mahela waits and clinically dispatches it through point
ooh, Kula comes back with a gentle offcutter at 128 kph and Baz nearly chops the steer back onto the stumps.
Guptill leans out to a length ball outside off and lets it go through
short of a length on off stump, Guptill gets bat on it this time and defends softly

whoa, Guptill has teed off. For once Kula misses the length and lands closer to the pads, Guptill reaches across and just lofts cleanly through the line over mid-on. That's clean as a whistle that's been through a washing machine cycle. Four to long on.
another strong comeback from Kula, lands the offcutter outside off and nips it into Guptill who inside edges onto the pad
123 kph, full on the pads, Guptill flicks gingerly wide of mid on and gets a single before the throw comes in
short of a length outside off, Baz leans out with angled face and steers backward of point.

ripper from Mathews. Seems like a fortuitous legcutter, since the seam was scrambled. Jumps up off the seam and rears away, Guptill pulls out like a man who took a towel out of the closet and then noticed that it was on fire
fuller, not so much movement, Guptill defends to the off side

aha, there's more diving there than in the Mumbai Swimming Club. Guptill taps a length ball to mid on and takes off, he dives in, Chamara Silva runs to the ball, tries to under-arm and dives in. He doesn't collect though. Easy single.
fuller length on off stump, Baz quietly leans into a forward defensive

whoa, Kapugedara has saved three runs. Short of a length outside off, Guptill plays a violent flat-batted smash towards mid off, Kapu runs across rapidly to his right, dives and deflects it to mid on. Lovely stuff
fuller to Baz, who stays on the crease and defends
he doesn't need any room to play the cut, does he. A standard 600 sq. ft Mumbai studio will do for Baz, who hangs back and cracks the cut from the line of off stump towards third man
legcutter straightening from leg and middle, Guptill defends off the front foot
fuller ball on the pads, Guptill plays an ominous short-arm flick with viciously perfect timing. Long on is in place, and just as well.
back of a length on off stump, Baz stays on the crease and defends as it cuts back in
Guptill seems intent on stealing as many singles as he can, while mid on hangs back on the circle. Fullish length from Mathews, dropped to mid on and he's away

Aha, Mahela takes a low catch it seems. Baz is not leaving! The third umpire has to check. First things first. An absolute peach of a legcutter from mathews, he lands this outside off and gets it to jag away off the seam. Baz was advancing into the steer, then saw it go away and tried to pull away, but the momentum was too far into the shot. It takes the edge even as he opens the face and dies away to the right of a diving Mahela ... who has taken it cleanly. The McCullums 0 - Mahela 2. What a ball, from Mathews, seam pointing away and the ball just follows suit after landing. This man's a superstar allrounder.
fullish ball angling across Ryder who lets it go. He's has a quiet World Cup so far.
full and on the pads this time, Ryder plays around the pads to mid on.
thumped away. That's a Ryder special;. Reluctantly minimal feet movement to a full ball angling across him, and he just smote it through the line into the covers. Whack.
Mathews wisely lands this short of a length, Ryder tries to punch in Saeed Anwatr style and times it well. He finds cover though.

lbw, hook, like and sinker. Guptill asks if he should review it, but Ryder wisely says no chance, mate. Kulasekara's inducker strikes, this is a special skill in a world full of outswing bowlers. He lands it outside off, back of a length. Guptill reaches across for a routine defensive stroke. Then the ball lands and moves in, accentuated further by the subtle angle Kula generated when he bowled from slightly wide of the crease. Guptill knows he's in trouble, but its too late to do anything other than a meek attempt to play round the pad. Hits the pad in front of off, Hawkeye says top of leg is on the way. Gone.
full and on the pads, Taylor plays it to the leg side
whoa, top take from Sanga, standing up to the stumps as Kula sends an inducker well wide down the leg side
he seemed to roll the fingers over this and get it to dart in again, Taylor pressed across and fished for it, and managed to get an inside edge to the leg side. Kula's working magic in Mumbai.
short of a length on middle and leg, Taylor gets across to cover the line and defend
closer to off this time, Taylor continues to be compact in defence off the front foot
ends with a regulation delivery that hinted at going away from off stump line as Taylor defended carefully to the off side
wide and fast, well outside off and Ryder chooses to let it pass
short of a length on the hips, Ryder whips it backward of square for a single
back of a length, keeps its line outside off as Taylor plays off the outer half into the off side
whangs this in short and fast at 142.4 kph and Taylor lets it go
Taylor is fishing away in Marine Drive. Short of a length outside off, he stays flat footed and goes for the cut, no luck with the bait this time.
fuller length on off stump, Taylor looks to force the drive into the covers, but can't get the gap.
finishes off with a fiery bouncer at 143.4 kph, it has Taylor's name written on it, and he does well to duck under and let it go
short of a length on off stump, cramping Ryder as he looks to drive off the back foot into the covers
again, fuller and a hint of inward movement as Ryder plays from the crease into the off side. Might want to play forward to Kula's delights.
this one ends a little too straight, and Ryder turns it off the pads backward of square for a single
Ross is on 0 after 11 balls. Tries to steer-drive a short of a length ball outside off,  but can't time it past mid off
legcutter goes away from outside off, Taylor is still runless as he defends to the off side without much timing
and again, leans half forward and blocks a back of length ball darting in towards mid on
slower ball, 120 kph - that's around the average pace of Munaf Patel; just sating - Ryder is a little early on the lunge but defends
too wide down the leg side, Ryder can't connect with the leg side slap and its a wide

dropped, whoa, is Tharanga awake? Ryder gets a short of length ball on the hips and slaps the pull a foot and a half over Tharanga's head at midwicket. He seemed to jump late and not jump high enough. Straight through where the hands should have been, and away for four
Kapugedara fumbles from mid off as Ryder drives down the ground and they get a single
no duck for Taylor today. He's away in really iffy fashion, guiding a short, fast away going ball over the head of the lone widish slip.

oh boy. Kula has converted what should have been four, what could have been a catch, into a six! Is Ross Taylor the luckiest man in the World Cup? Fuller length outside off, real pace from Malinga, Taylor goes for the upper-cut and slashes it towards Kula, standing a few feet in at third man. He tries to jump up and catch it over his head, and ends up parrying it over the ropes. Shades of the Trott controversy in Chennai yesterday. Would have been four if the fielder wasn't there. Ends up being a six, thanks to the fielder.
Malinga's figures are ruined by this over, Taylor defends a short ball on off stump.

Will they review it? Long discussion and they choose not to. Back of a length from Kula, lands well outside leg and hits the top of the pad as Ryder chips out and tries to whip across to the leg side.
fuller outside off, Ryder drives into the covers smoothly for a single
legcutter outside off, Taylor leans out to defend carefully into the off side
fuller and straighter, Taylor works it with the wrists towards mid on
back of a length, he keeps rolling the fingers over these legcutters. Taylor defends again after leaning out to off stump

more luck for Taylor, he's outlived the nine lives of the cat. Kula's patent inducker, Taylor looks to drive without getting the feet across and the inside edge nearly blitzes through the gap. It finds his leg on the way, and he's safe. Not by much.
angles across Ryder first up and he quietly dabs backward of point for a single
length ball on off stump, defended to the off side.
good shot from Rossco, waits for a delivery angling in to finish on his pads and them guides the flick past wide mid on for a couple.
again, Mathews angles in sharply and Rossco flicks again for a couple
nice half-stop at point, but can't stop Taylor from getting a couple. Short of a length outside off, he cracks the cut into the ground and Dilshan jumps up at point to stop it

cracko, Rossco! says Abhishek Purohit. The most viciously violently cut I've seen in some time. Sanga needs to console a visibly distraught Mathews after the shot. Back of a length outside off and he thumps it away after a half shimmy across. Absolutely smote the leather off it.
oho, hits the pad as Ryder looks to flick a full ball. Lands outside leg, and he plays all around it.
full delivery on off, defended into the off side
length ball angling across Ryder who defends into the off side for one
back of a length at 125 kph on off, Taylor gets half forward and blocks to the leg side
angles into the middle and leg line, not much movement for Kula anymore. Taylor defends from the crease
short ball, hurries into Taylor who looks to pull and gets it away to square leg
full delivery on off, Taylor leans into a drive towards extra cover
loopy delivery on off stump, driven straight to cover

too wide outside off, Taylor cashes in. Anyone else feels Mendis doesn't bowl as well as he used to in 2008? No turn on this ball. Taylor waits for it to spin in, sees its not coming in, waits and crunches it backward of point
fullish length on middle, Taylor drives solidly to mid on for a single
short of a length on Ryder's leg stump, worked off the pads to the leg side.
not even a degree of turn in Mendis' opening over. Length ball on off stump, defended solidly to the off side
fullish and angling into the pads from round the wicket, Ryder taps to the leg side off the front foot for one
short of a length and turning in, played down to long on from the crease
looped up on the pads, Ryder works another single wide of mid on
straighter one outside off, Taylor adjusts late to defend off the front foot
looped up on the off stump, Taylor paddles it along to Malinga at deep backward square leg
looped up outside off, Taylor drives cleanly to long off for one more. Good old, tuk tuk cricket going on
full outside off, Taylor drives down to widish mid on but finds the fielder
wider outside off, Taylor plays forward again and drives into the covers for a single
offie on middle and leg, breaking away and defended by Ryder
ooh, poor shot from Ryder, but he gets away it. Full and breaking away from outside off, he swipes across the line and just gets it away past midwicket

the stock market is looking up. Ryder's scrip is falling through. Mendis has nailed him with a straight carrom ball wafter than lands outside off and shoots through without deviation. Ryder doesn't get fully across and has a typically lazy feel for it, he was playing for the leggie. He ends up edging into Sanga's gloves.
tossed up well outside off, Williamson is away, driving with an opened face past point
short ball, breaking in and Williamson punches off the back foot towards cover where Silva does well to cut the single
fullish outside off, he works it back with the spin to the bowler
played into the off side carefully

he's completely whinged his normal delivery stride, and over-stepped. Doosra short and well outside off, Williamson cuts it with ease into the deep point area. Mendis runs a mile and slides to stop the fourth. Here comes the free-hit, but the field can change.
that's a good way to deliver a dot ball. Get the batsman bowled. Taylor looks for his famous slog sweep and misses.
doosra outside off, Taylor covers the line and defends
breaks in from outside off, Taylor reaches out to smother the spin and play to the leg side
googly outside off, cut away in front of point for a single
fuller, Taylor just plops forward and defends
tossed up slowly on off stump, Taylor leans out to defend once again
straight again, on middle and Taylor works it off the pads as he reaches across
short ball outside off, Taylor tries to cut but point stops it
over-pitched on the pads, Taylor dinks it straight at mid on.
offie from round the wicket, Williamson looks to cut but it gets big and goes past the outside edge

Sanga has done him in! Murali has done him in! Williamson looks completely foxed, Sanga jumps in joy, Murali's eyes smile more than his lips! This is top notch stuff from the old firm. Murali lands a doosra full and just outside off, Williamson leans out for the defensive, but it doesn't turn in. It goes away, and Williamson did not even know he was being lulled into a trap. He blindly dragged the backfoot out. Sanga collected, and removed the bails before you could say "Stumped" Gone!
tossed up on the stumps, worked with the wrists through to midwicket
looped up on off and middle, Taylor works it cautiously off the front foot to the leg side
shorter on off stump, Taylor jumps behind the line and defends
what a top-class over this was. Another spitting offie, lands on off and straightens into Taylor's defensive push down the track
angling into the pads, worked carefully off the pads towards midwicket for one.
back of a length on off stump, Taylor defends after getting half forward
hurries into him from short of a length and Taylor defends to midwicket
fuller on the toes, Taylor drives down to long on for a single
breaks in from outside off, Styris dabs with opened face to point and they take the single
carom ball, breaks away from middle and leg, driven cautiously to long on for a single

Murali is eating away at the NZ line up. Given lbw, but Taylor has refered it. Looked plumb. Did it land outside leg? The mat is awaited. Offie lands around leg stump, the mat is in, and the ball lands just inside the mat and the offie straightens enough to hit middle. Taylor was prodding forward, but he wasn't 2.5 m ahead. Gone. Murali on two legs is lethal. Murali, one on leg with a strained hammie seems to be even more lethal.
tossed up from over the wicket on leg and breaking away, Franklin defends gingerly
tossed up and going away from off, defended into the off side off the front foot
flighted on middle and breaking in, Styris drives against the spin to mid off
opens the face and defends an offie breaking in from outside off. Single towards point
flat delivery on the pads, Franklin defends as it turns away to the off side
ooh, nervy batting this. Styris gets half across and half prods at a skidder outside off. How close to the edge?
how did that not hit the stumps? Styris plays back to a ripping offie and cuts it onto the thigh and close to the stumps.
hint of room outside off, Styris cuts through point for one
ah, over-pitched too wide down the leg side and its gone for four. Murali is in no shape to chase that and just escorts it all the way.
offie, lands on off and breaks away, thuds into Franklin's pads as he presses forward. Huge appeal, but that was surely missing off
quicker one outside off, Franklin looks to cut and misses
tossed up on off, Styris dabs to the off side for a single
flighted outside leg and turning in, Franklin covers the line and defends
doosra on leg stump, Franklin reads it off the track and defends with bat and pad
on the pads, Franklin tries to work it to the leg side and they get a single

Muralitharan. Gazillion wickets in the international game. Still, as joyful as a school kid who got candy, every time he gets a wicket. He slows up the offie in the air and flights it generously on off and middle. Styris is a goner even before he knew it as he came forward into the drive. Fooled by the flight, foxed by the pace. He just scoops the drive back a foot and a half above Murali. The rest happens in slow motion. Murali jumps up, Murali collects. Mural lands. Murali jumps up again in joy, with the eyes popping and the lips widening into a smile. Two lovely jumps, one after the other. The ball is tossed up in the air, he collects it as it comes down and breaks into a joyous guffaw. Boy, cricket will miss Murali after this World Cup.
flighted on off stump, Nathan pokes it out to cover for one
full toss on off, driven back past the bowler for a single
flat on off stump, Franklin pokes it out to the off side
flat again on off stump, Franklin forces into the covers for a single
Nathan tries to steer a single to the off side, but can't beat point
now he gets the single, angling past point for one
flighted on leg stump, Franklin presses forward to smother the spin and defend
tossed up outside leg stump, Nathan glances it down to fine leg for a single
ripping offie well outside off and breaking away, Franklin lets it go
another one of those offies that zoot across, Franklin steers down to third man and the ball hurries away for four. Malinga slides a metre and a half behind the ball, this outfield is dripping wet.
tossed up on leg stump, Franklin drives it back and Murali fumbles, but no single
tossed up and straightening from off stump, poked into the off side for a single
flighted generously on middle, Nathan defends cautiously to mid on
flat offie on off stump, Franklin forces into the covers for a single
coming in from middle, turned away off the pads to midwicket
drifting into the pads, Franklin defends dourly down the track
short and just outside off, Franklin guides the cut past point for a single

Consider the irony. Natha McCullum has been caught by Mahela Jayawardene. And there's NO DOUBT about this one. Mahela pouches the tick edge that came straight at him at slip and hops away in glee. Nathan must be disappointed that he's out. He seems absolutely gutted to see who caught him. Dilshan is pleased to join the fun. Full delivery outside off, Nathan looks to play a forcing drive through the covers and gets an outside edge. It flies into Mahela and he consumes it with those safe hands. Irony.
tossed up on middle and off, worked to the off side.
loopy delivery curling into Franklin's forward defensive. Played into the off side
shorter outside off, played into the covers for one
tossed up well outside off from over the wicket, Oram fells fatally almost for the cover drive and gets it just past slip
Franklin defends to the off side as he leans out to the flight
Franklin gets to the pitch this time and drives wide of mid off for a single
and he lands one outside leg, Oram sweeps and gets pad on it down to short fine leg
speared into the pads, nurdled away square for a single
on the pads again, driven solidly down to long on for one
slow and full on middle and off, defended down the ground
again, very full from Dilshan and it is defended from the crease
flatter and hurrying in, Oram defends languidly down the track
back of a length on off stump, Oram defends again. Now this game is going nowhere.
tossed up on the pads, nurdled down to square leg for a single
loopy ball on off, not sure what Oram is trying to do. He defends to the off side again.
misses the sweep as Murali keeps it short of a length and slows it up. Goes through outside off and Sanga collects
comes forward to the flight this time and plays with the spin into the covers
Oram stays back and labours the flick through midwicket for a single
fuller on off, Franklin leans out and defends
back of a length outside off, Oram defends with hard hands to cover
intent from Oram finally, skips out and looks to mow over the leg side, he gets an inside edge to deep square leg for a couple
fullish ball on the pads, driven solidly down to long on for a single
speared into the pads, Franklin reaches forward and drives to the off side
angled into the pads, Oram flicks straight to midwicket
drifts down the leg side, and Oram helps it along towards short fine leg
loopy on off, Franklin drives with the spin into the covers for one
sliding onto the pads, Oram tickles it along to short fine leg for one

catching practice for the man who has come up to short cover. Murali has given NZ a lesson on playing offspin here. He's used spin, flight, dip, bounce - all elements of a spinner's guile to bamboozle a bunch that had no idea which one was turning which way. Slow and looped up on off, Franklin is late getting forward, doesn't quite get there and scoops a defensive push straight into Dilshan's lap. Easy as they come.
back of a length outside off and turning in, Southee lets it go
tossed up outside off, Southee pins his hopes in the comprehensive sweep round the corner and connects well. Away for four to square leg
straighter from Murali, another sweep but this time he doesn't get bat on it.
short offie breaking in, worked round the corner for a single
speared onto the pads, Oram nudges off the pad to the leg side
flat outside off, forced into the covers for a single
flat and hurrying into the batsman, he under-edges the cut to short third man
turning into the pads, turned through square leg for a single
flat on the pads, turned away to square leg for one more
sliding down the leg side and called a wide
full on the pads, worked to square leg for a single
drifting into the pads, tickled along to square leg for one more single
Oram skips out again, gets to the pitch and whacks the on-drive to long on

I think it's going to be referred, but Southee is a goner for sure. Rauf has given him out lbw and it has been refered. Carom ball, lands on middle, straightens enough to be hitting leg, around 4/5ths of the way up. Hits Southee's pad as he prods forward below the roll. All over bar the shouting.
slides a wicked straighter one past Bennett's befuddled prod. He's out there with a runner.
flighted from round the wicket, its poked into the covers for one to end the over
Oram seems to have left the hitting for a little too late. Over-pitched on leg stump, he hangs back, opens up the leg side by moving the front foot away and swats it away past mid on.
Oram's smashed another four down the ground. Another over-pitched ball on leg stump, he clears the legs and bangs it back straight. That's the Oram we know.
Oram is walking all around the crease, Malinga follows him with a full yorker and Oram barely gets the feet out of the way. Somehow, that missed leg stump
slow offcutter on middle, Oram backs away again and waits for it to come before bunting into the covers for one
no yorker yet. He bowls a mean bouncer and Bennett ducks under the flak as it whizzes by

oh yes. Malinga has straightened off stump with a scorcher than landed near the toes and thundered past Bennett's pointless poke. All over. The Lions have mauled the Kiwis today. This is a thumping win. And to think SL under-achieved with the bat, and had to contend with dew while bowling. Black Caps down.
